definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])

sentences.english: He grimaced at the bitter taste.
sentences.chinese: 他一嘗那苦味，做了個怪相。

sentences.english: He made a face and stuck his tongue out, and the girl began to cry.
sentences.chinese: 他做了個怪相伸了伸舌頭，那個女孩就被嚇哭了。

sentences.english: Then I made faces and jumped like a monkey.
sentences.chinese: 接着，我做着怪相，像猴子一樣來回跳着。

sentences.english: Or rather, his whole person was a grimace.
sentences.chinese: 更恰當地說，他整個人就是一副怪相。

sentences.english: He watches our grimacing faces with amusement.
sentences.chinese: 他帶着娛樂的心情看着我們的怪相。

sentences.english: At the circus, the clowns mopped and mowed.
sentences.chinese: 馬戲演出時，丑角扮怪相。

sentences.english: The ugly and monstrous face of Quasimodo leaves readers a deep impression.
sentences.chinese: 卡西莫多的醜陋的怪相給讀者留下深刻的印象。

definition: odd expression/funny looks/queer face/to grimace/to give sb funny looks/to pull faces
the men of today are sadly degenerated (idiom)
cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant
to put on an attitude/to pose
public morals are degenerating with each passing day (idiom)
bitter and hateful (idiom)/to grieve and lament (over sth)
lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
